alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Harnett; Sampson; Wayne (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 08 at 12:25AM EDT until July 08 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR CUMBERLAND, SOUTHEASTERN HARNETT, NORTHERN SAMPSON AND SOUTHERN WAYNE COUNTIES... At 1225 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated earlier thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area, with heavy rain ongoing. Up to 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fayetteville, Clinton, Mount Olive, Fort Bragg, Dunn, Godwin, Pope AFB, Hope Mills, Spring Lake, Erwin, Eastover, Coats, Newton Grove, Wade, Turkey, Falcon, Linden, Seven Springs, Spivey`s Corner and Hobbton. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
